title: Ski Mount Sneffels: Snake Couloir Guide
description: This in-depth route guide documents my self-planned ascent and ski descent of the Snake Couloir on Mount Sneffels — a 14,157-foot peak in the San Juan Mountains of Colorado. I researched, scouted, climbed, and skied the line over a 14-hour day, then built a resource from scratch to help others do the same. The page includes route beta, gear recommendations, GPS maps, and photography from the trip. It now ranks as a go-to reference for ski mountaineers, drawing over 1,000 visits in some seasons.

title: North Manitou Island Backpacking Guide
description: This is a comprehensive self-guided backpacking resource for exploring North Manitou Island, a remote destination in the Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore. I wrote all the copy, shot original photography, and designed the layout to make trip planning accessible for beginners. The guide covers ferry logistics, route options, gear checklists, and backcountry safety. It became one of the top-ranking resources on the topic, generating over 2,500 visits in a single year and more than 6,300 total — significantly increasing visibility for Origin Expeditions.

title: Intro to CalTopo: Backcountry Mapping Guide
description: This guide breaks down the essential features of CalTopo, a powerful online mapping tool for planning wilderness trips. I wrote and illustrated the entire piece to help beginners build confidence with digital maps — covering layers, markers, route tools, and printing options. Designed as a practical, no-jargon walkthrough, the guide has become a popular resource for trip planning and navigation prep, with over 1,500 views to date.

title: Remote Forecasting Tools for Planning Trips in Snow
description: This technical article walks readers through how to assess snowpack and avalanche risk remotely using free online tools like weather models, satellite imagery, and avalanche forecasts. I wrote and structured the guide to make complex information approachable for backcountry travelers without formal training. While the piece is niche, it was created as part of an interview assignment — and ultimately helped land me a job offer thanks to its clarity, depth, and practical value.
